results.title: Richard III
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions and Laurence Olivier
results.brief_description: Richard III is the story of one man’s unbridled lust for the crown. Richard’s ambition leaves all who oppose him dead, pawns in his ruthless bid for the throne. This is a majestic film in every sense of the word, and one of the greatest films ever produced in England. Directed by, and starring, Laurence Olivier with Ralph Richardson, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud.

results.title: Richard III
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Ron Cook as Richard III, Michael Byrne as Buckingham, Annette Crosbie as the Duchess of York. A succession of plots and murders sees Richard of Gloucester take over the throne of England from his brother Edward IV. But Richard has made many enemies along the way and Buckingham and Richmond raise armies against him. Richmond is the victor and, as Henry VII, plans to bring peace by linking the houses of Lancaster and York.

results.title: Richard II
results.creator_credit: BBC, Time-Life Films, Cedric Messina and David Giles
results.brief_description: A BBC production of Shakespeare’s “King Richard the Second” featuring Derek Jacobi as Richard the Second, Sir John Gielgud as Richard of Gaut and Wendy Hiller as the Duchess of York. One of thirty-seven plays by Shakespeare to be presented by the BBC over a six year period.

results.title: Richard et Cosima
results.creator_credit: Rene Letzgus, Dietrich Mack and Peter Patzak
results.brief_description:
Having persuaded the King that a new theater should be built to accomodate the performances of his tetralogy, Wagner and Cosima settle in a villa near Bayreuth, called ‘Wahnfried’. The film recounts Wagner’s often stormy relationship with Cosima.

Credits: Producers, Rene Letzgus, Dietrich mack ; director, Peter Patzak ; writers, Reinard Baumgart ; photography, Anton Peschke ; music, Peter Zwetkoff.
Cast: Otto Sander, Tatja Seibt, Fabienne Babe.

results.title: Rich and strange = East of Shanghai
results.creator_credit: British International Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: After coming into a small inheritance, a suburban couple, bored with life’s routine, seek a taste of the high life and excitement by going on a world cruise. One of Hitchcock’s personal favourites, the film is a sad/comic reflection upon marriage and the lives of ordinary people thrown into chaos. Stars Henry kendal and Joan Barry.

results.title: Rich & Poor: What Can We Do?
results.creator_credit: Film Inc., Alan Hart and Ian McFarlane
results.brief_description: In a mutual struggle for global survival the rich world and the poor world must work together. The basic problem is food and lasting change requires developmental aid. From “Five minutes to midnight”.

results.title: Rice: biggest small grain on earth
results.brief_description: Contrasts the labour-intensive rice production methods of Asia with the capital-intensive rice-growing methods used in North America. Also includes information on rice processing, types of rice and nutrition.
results.description: Contrasts the labour-intensive rice production methods of Asia with the capital-intensive rice-growing methods used in North America. Also includes information on rice processing, types of rice and nutrition.

results.title: Rice in Todays World
results.brief_description: This film focuses on the importance of rice as a major rice crop of the world, focusing on rice-producing areas such as the Orient. Factors contributing to rice growing, such as proper climate, water supply terrain are addressed and this work also contains an overview of the processes in the culture of rice.

results.title: Rice harvest
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Norma Bailey and Bob Lower
results.brief_description: Each fall, for generations, the families of the Pauingassi band have camped by northern Manitoba lakes, and combed the reedy shores with brooms, paddles and baskets for manomin - wild rice. The trade with the bush pilot begins the process by which an Indian staple and sacred crop becomes a white man’s luxury food. A quiet but haunting film.
